column2: â€œA consideration of the meaning and scope of s. 116 and of s. 136 (1) (d) of the Code
thus becomes necessary. Section 116 is a section contained in that part of the Code
dealing  with  the  investigation  of  offences  and  the  powers  of  Police  Officers  and
counterpart  of  s.  114  which  permits  the  release  of  an  accused  if  evidence  is
deficient. Section 116 (1) requires that a suspect be sent in custody to a Magistrate's
Court with jurisdiction when the information is well founded in the case of a non-
bailable offence. That is to say that the suspect should be so forwarded when the
Police Officer or inquirer comes to a conclusion that there is sufficient evidence in
the sense that a substantial case is made out at an early stage of an investigation
which can properly be sent before a Magistrate. Thereafter it is necessary for the
